issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: I followed instruction described from https://docs.hpcloud.com/eucalyptus/4.2.2/#install-guide/config_storage_ceph_rbd.html to update this property and got error message. [root@euca-clc eucalyptus]# euserv-describe-services SERVICE autoscaling ufs-01 ufs-01.autoscaling enabled SERVICE autoscalingbackend eucalyptus 10.60.1.10 enabled SERVICE bootstrap bootstrap 10.60.1.10 enabled SERVICE cloudformation ufs-01 ufs-01.cloudformation enabled SERVICE cloudwatch ufs-01 ufs-01.cloudwatch enabled SERVICE cloudwatchbackend eucalyptus 10.60.1.10 enabled SERVICE cluster zone-1 cc-01 enabled SERVICE compute ufs-01 ufs-01.compute enabled SERVICE dns ufs-01 ufs-01.dns enabled SERVICE euare ufs-01 ufs-01.euare enabled SERVICE eucalyptus eucalyptus 192.168.6.10 disabled SERVICE eucalyptus eucalyptus 10.60.1.10 enabled SERVICE identity ufs-01 ufs-01.identity enabled SERVICE imaging ufs-01 ufs-01.imaging enabled SERVICE imagingbackend eucalyptus 10.60.1.10 enabled SERVICE jetty eucalyptus 10.60.1.10 enabled SERVICE loadbalancing ufs-01 ufs-01.loadbalancing enabled SERVICE loadbalancingbackend eucalyptus 10.60.1.10 enabled SERVICE notifications eucalyptus 10.60.1.10 enabled SERVICE objectstorage ufs-01 ufs-01.objectstorage enabled SERVICE pollednotifications eucalyptus 10.60.1.10 enabled SERVICE reporting bootstrap 10.60.1.10 enabled SERVICE simpleworkflow ufs-01 ufs-01.simpleworkflow enabled SERVICE storage zone-1 sc-02 broken SERVICE tokens ufs-01 ufs-01.tokens enabled SERVICE user-api ufs-01 ufs-01 enabled SERVICE walrusbackend walrus walrus-01 enabled [root@euca-clc eucalyptus]# euctl | grep blockstorage zone-1.storage.blockstoragemanager = [root@euca-clc eucalyptus]# euctl zone-1.storage.blockstoragemanager=ceph-rbd euctl: error (ModifyPropertyValueType): Cannot modify zone-1.storage.blockstoragemanager.blockstoragemanager new value is not a valid value. comments.body:
Workaround: Restarting eucalyptus-cloud fixes this, and then you can set the property. 

[~mclark] notes that there are many of these types of JIRA issues at the moment, regarding problems with updating storage-related property values. On this one, note that it shows no valid values. It should show das, overlay, ceph etc. as valid values.

Excerpts from my recent IRC chat with Matt:

{noformat}
2016-06-07 17:48:40 <lincolnt>	Calyptos fails to set up walrus
2016-06-07 17:49:12 <lincolnt>	'//usr/bin/euctl objectstorage.providerclient=walrus' results in 'euctl: error (ModifyPropertyValueType): Cannot modify objectstorage.providerclient.providerclient new value is not a valid value.  Legal values are:'
2016-06-07 17:49:27 <lincolnt>	Note: no legal values shown at the end of that output!
2016-06-07 17:49:53 <nephomaniac>	lincolnt:  looks similar to the ticket discussed in the bug scrub today?
2016-06-07 17:53:05 <lincolnt>	It's NOT this one AFAIK:
2016-06-07 17:53:14 <lincolnt>	.issue EUCA-11684
2016-06-07 17:53:16 <eucabot>	lincolnt: EUCA-11684 (In Progress): euctl: error (ModifyPropertyValueType): no entities found for property one.storage.dasdevice - https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/EUCA-11684
2016-06-07 17:53:28 <nephomaniac>	. issue euca-12420
2016-06-07 17:53:29 <eucabot>	nephomaniac: EUCA-12420 (Unconfirmed): failed to update property for 'blockstoragemanager'  - https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/EUCA-12420
2016-06-07 17:53:38 <nephomaniac>	similar
2016-06-07 17:54:25 <lincolnt>	nephomaniac: That one is for blockstorage, mine is for objectstorage, but similar
2016-06-07 17:55:24 <nephomaniac>	there's probably a dozen ticket similar to this since 3.X. Would love to see this behavior simplified and have this go away
2016-06-07 17:56:32 <nephomaniac>	Some of this may also be caused by the many service restarts and the timing of the restarts the CB has in place today, …we should be removing those post 4.3 I think
2016-06-07 18:03:29 <lincolnt>	nephomaniac: Ok, known intermittent issue. Yeah, I bounced eucalyptus-cloud and then I could do the euctl cmds and objectstorage and blockstorage became 'enabled'. Thx
2016-06-07 18:05:11 <lincolnt>	nephomaniac: I see it's not timing related, because I tried the euctl cmd myself well after it was running a while, didn't work, had to bounce the cloud service.
2016-06-07 18:11:07 <nephomaniac>	lincolnt:  I think the CB timing exposes a bug in the system. I ran about 100 install over the last 3 weeks, same hw, config, topo, etc. attempting to find a method that works 100% of the time. I got up to about 95-98% using scripted re-deploys and restarts of the cloud if they get wedged like this, but even with that this issue still finds a way a pop up
2016-06-07 18:12:18 <lincolnt>	'CB'?
2016-06-07 18:12:29 <lincolnt>	cookbook?
2016-06-07 18:12:36 <nephomaniac>	sorry yep cookbook
2016-06-07 18:14:21 <nephomaniac>	the cookbook needs an overhaul/re-org to remove the service restarts too. It may need to do a single start or restart but I think today a vanilla install will restart the cloud service 3-4 times. I think this is what exposes that bug… although the ticket from the field may have been a manual install?
{noformat}

Yes, this issue was a manual install, but it's still the same bug I think. The cookbook multiple restarts just shows it more often.
[~yeonki] [~lincoln.thomas] - Can you tell me which packages you were running when you hit this? Do you recall?

Restarting eucalyptus-cloud doesn't work.
and I've installed eucalyptus 4.2.2. 

{code}
[root@euca-clc ~]# rpm -qa | grep euca
eucalyptus-common-java-4.2.2-0.0.24196.37.el6.x86_64
euca2ools-release-3.3-1.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-admin-tools-4.2.2-0.0.24196.37.el6.noarch
eucanetd-4.2.2-0.0.24196.37.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-service-image-1.57-0.93.110.el6.noarch
euca2ools-3.3.1-0.0.1771.8.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-common-java-libs-4.2.2-0.0.24196.37.el6.x86_64
eucaconsole-4.2.2-0.0.7688.44.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-release-4.2-1.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-4.2.2-0.0.24196.37.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-cloud-4.2.2-0.0.24196.37.el6.x86_64
{code}
[~yeonki] Which OS are you running on? Also, did you install Euca from scratch or did you use Faststart or Calyptos?
OS is CentOS 6.7, I didn't use Fasttart or Calyptos. I installed it manually.

When I checked cloud-debug.log on storage cluster node, I found so many 
'Wating for system view with database...'

{code}
Tue Jun 14 23:32:29 2016  INFO [Bootstrap:main] ================================================================================
Bootstrap stage: RemoteConfiguration.load()
================================================================================
Tue Jun 14 23:32:29 2016  INFO [Bootstrap:main] :1465918349144:Bootstrap:bootstrap:BOOTSTRAPPER_LOAD:RemoteConfiguration:com.eucalyptus.bootstrap.Hosts.HostMembershipBootstrapper

Tue Jun 14 23:32:29 2016  INFO [Hosts:main] Searching for potential coordinator: null
Tue Jun 14 23:32:32 2016  INFO [Hosts:main] Waiting for system view with database...
....
{code}

I assumed that my storage cluster node (192.168.6.20) cannot connect to CLC (192.168.6.10)
192.168.6.5 node is UFS node.

This problem has resolved. 
I realized that multicase communication should be enabled between CLC and SC  ( IP 228.7.7.3 on UDP port 8773), according to the below thread:
[https://groups.google.com/a/eucalyptus.com/forum/#!topic/euca-users/fk0KdJ9tRlQ]

I checked multicast on CLC node 
{code}
[root@euca-clc ~]# netstat -g
IPv6/IPv4 Group Memberships
Interface       RefCnt Group
--------------- ------ ---------------------
lo              1      224.0.75.75
lo              1      all-systems.mcast.net
eth0            1      all-systems.mcast.net
eth0.1601       1      224.0.75.75
eth0.1601       1      228.7.7.3                   <=  Wrong connection
eth0.1601       1      all-systems.mcast.net
eth0.1602       1      224.0.75.75
eth0.1602       1      all-systems.mcast.net
eth0.601        1      224.0.75.75
eth0.601        1      all-systems.mcast.net
metabr          1      all-systems.mcast.net
vn2_9528ca      1      all-systems.mcast.net
vn2_e8c1aa      1      all-systems.mcast.net
{code}

I found IP 228.7.7.3 was established via eth0.1601 (it should've been on eth0)
I changed default GW IP based on eth0 and restarted network service.   
After that, it has been successfully connect to CLC.

{code}
[root@euca-cc eucalyptus]# tail -f cloud-debug.log
Thu Jun 16 13:49:32 2016  INFO [Hosts:main] Waiting for system view with database...

Thu Jun 16 13:49:44 2016  INFO [Hosts:main] Waiting for system view with database...
Thu Jun 16 13:49:47 2016  INFO [Hosts:main] Waiting for system view with database...
Thu Jun 16 13:49:50 2016  INFO [Hosts:main] Waiting for system view with database...
Thu Jun 16 13:49:53 2016  INFO [Hosts:main] Waiting for system view with database...
Thu Jun 16 13:49:53 2016  INFO [Hosts:main] Found system view with database: Host 192.168.6.10 #16 /192.168.6.10 coordinator=192.168.6.10 booted db started=1466056161808 [/10.60.1.10, /172.11.6.10, /172.11.6.10, /192.168.6.10]
Thu Jun 16 13:49:53 2016  INFO [Hosts:main] Waiting for system view to settle till 1466056311808 for coordinator 1466056161808 (118 secs).
Thu Jun 16 13:50:23 2016  INFO [Hosts:main] Found system view with database: Host 192.168.6.10 #23 /192.168.6.10 coordinator=192.168.6.10 booted db started=1466056161808 [/10.60.1.10, /172.11.6.10, /172.11.6.10, /192.168.6.10]
{code}

Finally, I tried to run the command to configure block storage.It worked well.
{code}
[root@euca-clc ~]# euctl zone-1.storage.blockstoragemanager=ceph-rbd
zone-1.storage.blockstoragemanager = ceph-rbd
{code}
 
Thank you for your help.
Thanks [~yeonki]. Do you feel there is anything lacking in our install docs that can be improved as a result of this issue?

Hi, Janathan. 

As you can see, this root cause of the problem came from the situation where SC could not connecting to CLC.
While I am searching any resolution related to this issue, I found several same cases with me. 
The common symptoms was the log produced so many 'Waiting for system view with database...'
I don't know whether they resolved this issue or not, however, It is good to be mentioned in the document regarding the symptom and its resolution in troubleshooting section.
This issue turned out to be a system configuration issue, so no fix was needed.
